title: How to Prepare Shrimp for Cooking

steps.title: Buy shrimp that has not been peeled or deveined.
steps.content: Buy shrimp that has not been peeled or deveined.

steps.title: Inspect the packaging prior to your purchase.
steps.content: Inspect the packaging prior to your purchase. Look for ice on the shrimp or a break in the bag. If you see ice on the shrimp, it's likely the shrimp have been thawed and refrozen. Select a different bag to buy.

steps.title: Defrost the shrimp.
steps.content: Defrost the shrimp. Remove the shrimp from the bag and refrigerate overnight in a bowl of cold water.

steps.title: Soak the shrimp in salt water to replenish their freshness once they are thawed and before you clean them.
steps.content: Soak the shrimp in salt water to replenish their freshness once they are thawed and before you clean them.

steps.title: Remove the shell to the shrimp by holding it with a few fingers of one hand and pull off its legs using the fingers of your other hand.
steps.content: Remove the shell to the shrimp by holding it with a few fingers of one hand and pull off its legs using the fingers of your other hand. [1] X Research source Peel back the shell and remove by using your thumbs, and remove. The head will come off too.

steps.title: Remove the tail at this point, if you wish, by holding the body of the shrimp and pulling the tail.
steps.content: Remove the tail at this point, if you wish, by holding the body of the shrimp and pulling the tail. The shell will also come off.

steps.title: Devein by making a cut down the back of the shrimp using a small utility or paring knife.
steps.content: Devein by making a cut down the back of the shrimp using a small utility or paring knife. You will see the vein. [2] X Research source Pull the vein out using your knife and rinse the shrimp. You can also use something small like a toothpick to remove the vein.

steps.title: Place the shrimp in a fresh bowl of water to keep them fresh while you clean the rest of the shrimp you will be using.
steps.content: Place the shrimp in a fresh bowl of water to keep them fresh while you clean the rest of the shrimp you will be using.

steps.title: Prepare fresh shrimp using the same steps as for frozen shrimp by removing the shell and the veins.
steps.content: Prepare fresh shrimp using the same steps as for frozen shrimp by removing the shell and the veins. The only difference is the smell of fresh shrimp. [3] X Research source If you smell something that smells like ammonia, this is shrimp to avoid. [4] X Trustworthy Source US Food and Drug Administration U.S. government agency responsible for promoting public health Go to source Otherwise, prepare the fresh shrimp the same way as you would frozen shrimp; removing the shell/head, tail optional, and the vein.
